intro: Ichnanthus hirtus, commonly known as the hairy twayblade, is a small, herbaceous plant belonging to the orchid family (Orchidaceae). It is native to the eastern United States and thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands. The plant has slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, white or greenish flowers that are clustered in spikes. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. Ichnanthus hirtus is a perennial plant that plays a role in maintaining the ecological balance of its habitat.
